in_ports.name: positions
in_ports.hint:
Contains either array of pairs (x,y), describing position of the centers of the rectangles,
or array of blocks of 4 numbers (x₁+x₂)/2, (y₁+y₂)/2, x₂−x₁+1, y₂−y₁+1, describing the centers and sizes of the rectangles.

controls.name: percents
controls.description: If true, all numbers below, excepting the line thickness, are measured in percents of image sizes (right=100 means right bound of image etc.)

controls.name: left
controls.description: Specifies x₁ (in pixels or percents) for the rectangle x₁≤x<x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂; if x₁<0, it is replaced with dimX+x₂ (where dimX is image width).

controls.name: top
controls.description: Specifies y₁ (in pixels or percents) for the rectangle x₁≤x<x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂; if y₁<0, it is replaced with dimY+x₂ (where dimX is image height).

controls.name: right
controls.description: Specifies x₂ (in pixels or percents) for the rectangle x₁≤x≤x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂; if x₂<0, it is replaced with dimX+x₂ (where dimX is image width); ignored if width>0. In other words, positive values x₁ and x₂ are measured from the left image bound, negative — from the right bound.

controls.name: bottom
controls.description: Specifies y₂ (in pixels or percents) for the rectangle x₁≤x<x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂; if y₂<0, it is replaced with dimY+y₂ (where dimY is image height); ignored if height>0. In other words, positive values y₁ and y₂ are measured from the top image bound, negative — from the bottom bound.

controls.name: width
controls.description: If width>0, it overrides x₂ above and specifies result width x₂−x₁+1 (in pixels or percents) of the rectangle x₁≤x≤x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂; ignored if zero.

controls.name: height
controls.description: If height>0, it overrides y₂ above and specifies result height y₂−y₁+1 (in pixels or percents) of the rectangle x₁≤x≤x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂; ignored if zero.

controls.name: thickness
controls.caption: Line thickness
controls.description: Thickness of the rectangle line (in pixels); 0 means solid rectangle.

controls.caption: Color
controls.name: color
controls.description: See supported color formats in "Create constant matrix" function.
